original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up in mid-morning trade, rupee appreciates
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s bond yields were slightly up during mid-day trade on Wednesday as results of a bill auction is awaited, while the rupee was trading at 317.30/50 against the US dollar in the spot market, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 was quoted at 28.40/60 percent, slightly up from 28.30/50 percent at yesterday’s close.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 30.00/50 percent on Wednesday, steady from 30.00/25 percent at last close.
The rupee was trading at 317.30/50 against the US dollar in the spot market appreciated from the last close at 317.50/318.50. (Colombo/May10/2023)
